COMFORT: Soft, supple, and cushioned padding supports your body as you lean into your bends, twists, sit ups and, hyperextensions.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Sunny Health & Fitness Hyperextension Roman Chair with Dip Station - SF-BH620062 Whether you are looking to add another piece to your home gym or get in a quick but intense workout in your living room, the Sunny Health & Fitness Foldable Roman Chair would be a perfect inclusion. The integrated dip bars provide for a multi-functional home workout experience. Adjustable, portable, comfortable, and convenient, the Sunny Health & Fitness Foldable Roman Chair - SF-BH620062 may just be the missing piece of equipment you need to complete your total body workouts. 10 Adjustable heights settings3 Adjustable incline anglesFoam padding dims: 8L x 7.5W x 4.5H in (ea.)Adjustable height: Min 25.2 in/Max 34.1 inFoam rollersBuilt-in dip bars330 weight capacity

ADJUSTABILITY Three incline settings allow you to change up your workouts and add variety to your strength and training routines. COMFORT Soft, supple, and cushioned padding supports your body as you lean into your bends, twists, sit ups and, hyperextensions. DIP BARS The dual functionality of the Foldable Roman Chair allows you to focus on not only your core, glutes and back but also on your upper body as well with the integrated dip bars. SPACE EFFICIENT Looking for a great workout but tight on space? The Sunny Health & Fitness Roman Chair folds virtually flat for convenient and easy storage.

ROBUST DESIGN Engineered for the toughest stretches and exercises; This Roman Chair has a max weight capacity of 330 LB. PORTABILITY Transportation wheels at the front of the units let you effortlessly move your Roman Chair. Just fold, tilt and roll away! FOOT PLATES Maintain stable and proper form using the foot plates for a level and unshakable squat foundation. PADDED ROLLERS Foam padded leg rollers ensure that your lower body is secure and protected for all manners for exercises.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I do 10x20 emoms with a 50lb kettlebell on this and I'm 235. No flexing, no stressing, no weird noises. Solid unit. I'm not going over 50, I'll just do more reps. But if you're a big guy I can vouch that this thing won't break under normal use from a bigger guy. Beware if you're doing head turning amounts of weight though because it's built to be foldable and portable and though it's sturdy it's not made out of bulldozer grade steel.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Rating 5 Star but
reviews.reviewText: This would be a 4.5 star if it was an option. The cost to get what this offers is so much cheaper than commercial grade ones, but just know a couple of these issues below-The washers it comes with are terrible, you will want to not even use them-You will need to tighten screws with Allen wrench every few uses-The design to increase/decrease angle is always preferred to be like this where you don't have to screw an unscrew anything, but it makes it slightly less stable-The pad caps are pretty funky, they stick out as some other pictures have shown.HOWEVER, definitely still got to give 5 stars. the ankle pad design where it flips up instead of just being locked in is so perfect. The hip pads are REALLY firm, I would almost prefer them to be a little squishier but they will last longer and are better for the exercises. Everything is metal. Also I am 220 pounds, stockier build so people who weigh less will probably have basically no wobble, and even I have very little wobble like very very little so I could see people who weigh quite a bit more than me being able to use this.Just tighten the screws regularly and don't use the washers and this is the perfect roman chair for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars No room for your male organs.
reviews.reviewText: Metal is solid, all the holes lined up, clear directions, even the hardware is labeled for each step. And it went together without a problem.There are 3 issues to consider:1. The main issue is the two pads that you rest your pelvic area on are very close together leaving almost no room for your testicles or your shaft so everything is smashed up. This might not be a issue with every guy. I’m able to reposition at the beginning of each set to where it’s bearable.2. Although the metal is strong, the entire thing is just flimsy when doing dips. It does just fine for hypertensions, but wobbles around when doing dips.3. In addition to being wobbly during dips it’s also a little too small for doing dips. My knees just touch the ground at the bottom of my rep. I’m 6’ tall.With that being said, it folds up nice and the wheels are nice for moving it around.I think for the price and storage size you won’t get any better.So if you don’t have room for a bigger non-folding dip bar, I would get this.If your mainly concerned about doing hyperextensions this thing will do. The dip bars are nice for getting on and off the machine.Just have to watch the testes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This Roman Chair is awesome!!! It arrived quickly and I was able to put it together in less than 30 minutes. The directions were very easy to understand, and all the nuts and bolts are kitted, so you don't have to figure out which washers go with which bolts. The chair is very well made, and very sturdy. It sets well on our floor, and we are able to fold it up quickly and roll it away for storage if needed. My husband and I both use it to strengthen our core muscles. My husband weighs 190 lbs. You will not be disappointed with this purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for improving back and core
reviews.reviewText: Super sturdy. Folds up compactly for storage when not in use. A great addition to a home gym!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I have some lower back problems, got this to stretch it out and strengthen the muscles. It's sturdy and I never feel like it's tipping or shifting. Dip bar are great for catching yourself but I wouldn't try to use them for dips

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Way better than I even thought it would be
reviews.reviewText: This is a budget option that I thought would be wobbly, but it isn't. It's very sturdy, and well built. It delivers on all of it's promises, and feels very safe. It's heavy enough to inspire confidence, but light enough to easily fold up and wheel into a corner when not in use. I'm surprised that they don't show this in the images or video, but it does stand up on it's own when folded away. You just have to be carful of your floors because of the metal edge on the foot plates. If they added some rubber to those it would be perfect. I might do that myself.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: A solid quality piece of kit.
reviews.reviewText: I'm 6' 2", 200lbs (91kg) so am keen that anything I buy to carry my weight, plus more, is solid and well built.When this arrived I was firstly impressed by how lovingly packaged and laid out in its box this was. All parts are numbered sequentialy with clear instructions for construction, that come with it, in an A4 size booklet. Following the instructions exactly, the machine takes shape easily and with minimum fuss.Each part is well made and well finished and the end result is very pleasingly heavy and strong, comparing favourably with any other home gym equipment I have had in the past. Most gyms I have been to don't seem to have Roman Chairs these days due to Health and Safety and the potential for easy back injuries if they are not used appropriately.On this subject I would recommend researching how to use the Roman Chair thoroughly on YouTube. There are many videos, featuring all levels of ability, available for free, with advice from career professionals. this being said, the first thing I found out was that everything I thought was wrong and, fortunately I started using it correctly from the start, thanks to the available guidance..If I had jumped in and just got on to it, in addition to wasting my energy, I could have hurt myself.It is fully adjustable and takes my weight easily in all positions. It folds away to about the size of a large ironing board. It's smart and will certainly last for a very long time. For the money, I think this is an absolute bargain. It usually takes me a long tome to get round to writing feedback about my purchases on Amazon. Weeks, even months, go by but I only got this a couple of days ago and, perhaps due to endorphins from home exercising this afternoon, I feel compelled to recommend this to anyone who is hesitating about whether this is any good. It is. I'm happy and am looking forward to having glutes like cannonballs, a washboard stomach and grapefruit shoulders. All I have to do now is put in the necessary, countless, hours of work to get them.

reviews.reviewTitle: 脚の長さが不安でしたが、大丈夫でした。
reviews.reviewText: 海外のレビューしかなく、胴長短足の私ではどうなのかと不安でしたが、問題なく調整の範囲で合いました。股下70cmほどですが、調整の穴一つ残して、短い方から二つ目でピッタリでした。商品説明によると10段階で23cmの幅で高さ調整できるので、股下が60cm～65cmでもシューズを着用したり、工夫すれば使えるかと思います。説明書は英語とその他外国語だけでしたが、内容物は不足品なく、組み立て方は、説明書の画とボルトの番号を見れば分かる物でした。穴の位置ズレも無く、付属のレンチとスパナでしっかり締めて完成です。ガタつきもなく、折りたたむ事もでき、片方の足にはローラーが付いているので、移動もそれほど難しくありません。もう片方の足にはアジャスターが付いているので、床に合わせて調整できます。使用感はとても良いです。45度固定のものも販売されておりますが、角度調整できるタイプを選んで正解でした。

reviews.reviewTitle: Bolt holes don’t line up - infuriating!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 5, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Works great, looks a Lot better in real life than on the pics(it looks chunkier and more sturdy). Great for extension, glutes, oblique crunch, dips and press ups. We'll worth the money

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 7, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Great tool added to my workout, hitting the Glutes and lower back, which is great for balance and stability , Seeing a slight difference to stomach too
